title: LOKI: Every Clue That it Was Really KANG, All Along | MARVEL Series Explained
author: ScreenCrush
comment: I thought the see you soon just meant another variant of him would see her soon

Anybody else realized that the MCU has successfully set up an "uno reverse" so-to-speak style method of being able to reboot an entire franchise without it seeming entirely like a cash-grab and a bit more acceptable as the multiverse?

My guess is that Kang was looking for a Loki in all the multiverse to be willing to kill him. That’s why there were so many of them pruned. But he was experimenting with them and then he change his approach and considered stealing them when they were little. That’s why kid Loki and the child Loki (sylvie) but because she scape then he knew she was the one. That’s why Kang emphasized in saying that she will never trust anyone. And the nexus event went Loki and sylvie were together in lamentis was because she was starting to trust Loki. And if that happen Kang wouldn’t die. In a way the glorious purpose of Sylvie was to kill Kang and start the multiverse. Which make sense since Kang was already tired and bored (he said that).
The variants of marvel breakdowns are Screen Crush, New Rockstars, and The Canadian Lad.
description:
Loki's finale revealed that the man behind the curtain was actually the new MCU villain Kang the Conqueror...kind of. He's actually more like the Marvel comics villain Immortus, an older version of Kang. But still, it's fun to go back and watch the show for every clue that it was actually Kang the entire time.
